title: Job Openings at FoodCourt
content:
FoodCourt was founded in September 2021 with A goal of transforming how people enjoy their favorite meals, focusing on delivering quality and variety with every order. From Nigeria to the world, FoodCourt is redefining food delivery with an emphasis on quality, variety, and convenience. We are on A mission to deliver exceptional dining experiences right to your doorstep—wherever you are. Through innovation and strategic partnerships, we've expanded our offerings to bring better food experiences to more people with A commitment to quality, convenience, and exceptional service, we have become A go-to choice for our customers. As we look ahead, our goal is to reach more communities enhancing our services, and continue delivering exceptional dining experiences. FoodCourt currently has two branches with the head office in Lekki and the second branch in Obanikoro.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head Chef

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To lead the kitchen team, design menus, oversee food preparation, and ensure consistent quality, hygiene, and cost efficiency in all culinary operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and supervise kitchen staff across all sections.
	Develop and update menus aligned with customer preferences and business goals.
	Ensure food quality, taste, and presentation meet company standards.
	Manage food costs, stock levels, and supplier relationships.
	Enforce health, safety, and hygiene regulations.
	Train, mentor, and evaluate culinary staff.


Working Conditions:


	
	Full-time, on-site, flexible hours including weekends/holidays.
	


KPIs


	Menu innovation and customer satisfaction.
	Food cost control within budget.
	Consistent quality & hygiene compliance.
	Staff performance and retention.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Culinary Degree or equivalent.
	5+ years in a leadership role in professional kitchens.
	Strong leadership, creativity, and financial management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: Careers@getfoodcourt.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Sous Chef

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To assist the Head Chef in managing the kitchen, supervising staff, and ensuring quality and efficiency in daily food operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee kitchen operations in Head Chef’s absence.
	Supervise and coordinate staff during shifts.

title: Job Openings at Felton Energy Services Limited
content:
Felton Energy Services Limited (FESL) is an indigenous oil & gas procurement, operation and maintenance company in Nigeria. The company was established to supply global customers with Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial and Engineering Products, on time and at the most competitive prices. FESL has unrivalled commitment to the Oil & Gas Industry and has gained support of the leading manufacturers which ensures our solutions are at the forefront oftoday’s technology.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior HSE Coordinator

Job Locations: Port Harcourt, Rivers 

Service Dimension
     

            
    




	Ensure the health, safety, and environmental well-being of workers and operations within the Gas Turbine Power Plant.
	Support the FOPS Head of operation to ensure manpower, equipment, services and procedures are adequate to comply with
	Regulatory Codes & Standards, Company Rules and Best practices as far as Safety and Environment are concerned.
	Role to be transversely engaged within Field Operations disciplines and on-board personnel in diffusing HSE philosophy and training
	with a view to continually improve COMPANY Safety Culture
	Office Power Plant annual HSE performance tracking to ensure consistency with the HSE objectives set


Activities:


	Assists the FOPS Head of Maintenance in the implementation of the Health, Safety and Environment standards & objectives, in compliance with the One MAESTRO, COMPANY HSE Management System and other COMPANY Referential.
	Ensure the e-POB is updated regularly.
	Support the FOPS HOM to actively lead Company HSE awareness and initiative schemes, ensure compliance with/application of all relevant statutory and Company HSE standards on the operational sites
	In liaison with the FOPS HOM, act as a focal point for all HSE statistics reporting relating to Field Operations onshore Office Power Plant activities weekly (Collates for review anomaly reports issued from Office Power Plant and record/trend incident)
	Ensure HSE training requirements for all OPP personnel (staff and contract) are completely captured in SafePass, HSEPass and ePOB as the case may be then monitored to drive compliance and report HSE training performance weekly.
	Stand down review of Incident/REX notifications and their Synergi cases, then follow up the implementation of all FOPS actions in Synergi arising from incident investigation reports, audits implementation, etc.
	Assist the FOPS HOM in preparation of reports on key HSE events and related FOPS activities (FORUM, CODIV, STANDOWN,
	AWAY-DAY, etc), then monitor OPP HSE Performances (objectives, activity plan, KPI)
	Develop FOPS monthly HSE Performance reports following the direction of the FOPS HOM and assist in the preparation, coordination and organization of the quarterly base HSE Committee Meetings (CODIV)
	Facilitate and participate in contractors HSE MS audits; operational sites HSE audits & inspections as well as report, monitor and update all actions emanating from them, including OPERSAFE and MAESTRO Audit corrective actions
	Participate in hazard studies / risk assessments undertaken for the modification of installations and the execution of operations when the need arises to ensure the safe execution of operations; and that risks are adequately managed
	Lead specific Operations Safety reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS) – HAZOP, HAZID, etc.
	Conducting regular inspections of work areas to identify potential hazards and ensuring adherence to safety protocols.
	Working with relevant stakeholders to implement corrective actions and prevent recurrence of incidents.
	Leading and participating in safety committees and other initiatives to foster a culture of safety
	Communicating safety information effectively to all employees, including toolbox talks and safety alerts
	Ensuring compliance with all relevant safety regulations, standards, and company policies
	Keeping up to date with the latest safety standards and best practices in the turbine industry.
	Ensuring that all employees have the necessary knowledge and skills to perform their jobs safely.
	Conducting internal audits to assess the effectiveness of safety programs and identify areas for improvement.
	Contribute to development of REX from event/activity reports; distribution of REX (HSE alerts, FBN, SFN) and follow up implementation of REX recommendations
	Follow up of the implementation of the FOPS HSEQ activity plan in line with the HSEQ objectives set for the year to ensure adequate monitoring, regular update and effective communication of the HSEQ activities.
	Participate in the review of key operational HSE document (SIMOPS/HSE Dossiers, specific procedures, bridging document, etc.)
	Coordinate and deliver (where required) identified HSE training needs of existing asset personnel and follow up their HSE training compliance (company and contractor); also support the FOPS HOM in providing relevant HSE awareness sessions to new persons arriving the division.
	Participate in site operations Emergency Preparedness and implementation as required including drafting of Emergency
	To make certain that all risk analyses are properly performed, and all control measures are implemented before commencement of any construction activity.
	To assist in the investigation of incident/accidents to determine their underlying causes, report anomalies and check corrective actions.
	To monitor the implementation of actions arising from incident, accident, audit and inspection analyses
	To ensure first aid materials and equipment are available on the sites, in liaison with the Contractor
	To propose amelioration actions to improve HSE efficiency and follow up on implementation of such actions. Take an active part in site activity planning and coordination meetings


Context and Environment:


	Creation of safety and security awareness and promotion of best practices with adequate emphasis on the 12 Golden Rules.
	Ensuring adequate training of personnel involved in the work on HSE related matters.
	Multi-cultural organization with multiple HSE interfaces and natural resistance to changes.
	Responsibility for providing independent audit and inspection opinion substantiated with evidence and facts. acts as a champion for safety, working to create a safe and healthy work environment for everyone involved in turbine-related activities


Accountabilities:


	Attend and facilitate the holding of site and departmental HSE committee meetings
	Coordinate DW Field Operations inputs to PPE procurement; issue of PPE to relevant crew and maintenance of contingencies
	Facilitating HSE audits (pre-start-up, facility, etc.), co-ordinate management facility inspection visits and JST facilities inspections


Requirements


	Engineering degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, Petroleum or Safety, fluent in English with good communication skills
	Professional Experience: 10 years in Oil and Gas (E&P), 5 years in HSE position of similar HSE Responsibilities
	Experience in a construction and operation environment, in Safety Engineering techniques, (HAZOP, PTR, HAZID and Audits).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: wendy@feltonenergy.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Legal Officer (Entry Level)

Job Location: Trans Amadi, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Reports To: Head of Legal

Job Scope


	The Legal Officer will provide legal support across the company’s operations, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements, assisting with contract drafting and review, and supporting dispute resolution processes.
	This role is ideal for a recent graduate with 1–2 years of experience who is eager to grow their career in corporate law within the oil and gas industry.


Responsibilities


	Assist in drafting, reviewing, and managing contracts, agreements, and other legal documents.
	Conduct legal research and provide advice on regulatory and compliance matters.
	Support the company in managing disputes, claims, and litigation matters.
	Ensure compliance with corporate governance requirements and applicable laws.
	Maintain proper records of legal documents and correspondence.
	Liaise with external legal counsel, regulators, and stakeholders as required.
	Work closely with the Head of Legal to support internal and external legal issues.
	Stay updated on relevant laws, policies, and industry regulations.


Required Experience & Qualifications


	Bachelor of Laws (LL.B) Degree from a recognized university.
	0 - 2 years of post-NYSC experience in a legal role, preferably in corporate/commercial law.
	Nigerian Law School qualification (BL).


Desired Skills & Competencies:


	Strong research and analytical skills.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	High attention to detail and organizational ability.
	Ability to work under supervision while demonstrating initiative.
	Integrity, professionalism, and strong ethical judgment.
	Interest in the oil and gas industry and corporate law practice.


Salary
N200,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: wendy@feltonenergy.net using “Legal Officer” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Business Development Executive

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

Job Scope


	The Business Development Executive is responsible for supporting the business development team in identifying new opportunities, building client relationships, and driving revenue growth.
	This role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience, especially from a banking or financial services background, who are eager to expand their careers in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities


	Identify and research potential clients and business opportunities.
	Assist in conducting market research to analyze industry trends.
	Support the development and maintenance of client relationships.
	Participate in meetings and follow up on client inquiries.
	Assist in preparing proposals, presentations, and sales pitches.
	Coordinate meetings and organize sales documentation.
	Update and manage client information in the CRM system.
	Monitor industry developments and share relevant insights.
	Represent the company at networking and promotional events.
	Perform other tasks as assigned by the Business Development Lead.


Required Experience and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
	1-2 years of experience in business development, sales, or customer relationship roles, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.


Desired Skills:


	Communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain client relationships.
	Foundational knowledge of sales, marketing, and business development principles.
	Self-driven, proactive, and capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills, with keen attention to detail.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and a basic understanding of CRM tools and data entry processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: wendy@feltonenergy.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Finance Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Reports To: MD/ CEO

Job Scope


	The Finance/Accounts Manager will oversee the financial operations of the company, ensuring accuracy in financial reporting, compliance with regulations, and efficient management of company resources.
	The role requires a detail-oriented and strategic professional to drive financial performance and support business objectives.


Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day financial operations, including accounting, budgeting, and financial reporting.
	Prepare and analyze financial statements to ensure accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards.
	Monitor cash flow, revenue, and expenses to optimize financial performance.
	Supervise accounts payable and receivable functions, ensuring timely processing of transactions.
	Develop and implement financial controls and policies to enhance efficiency and mitigate risks.
	Assist in the preparation of tax filings, audits, and compliance with relevant financial regulations.
	Work closely with the CFO to develop financial strategies that align with business objectives.
	Prepare budget forecasts and financial reports for senior management review.
	Collaborate with external auditors, tax authorities, and financial institutions.
	Support financial planning, cost control, and business performance analysis.


Required Experience & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 6 years of experience in finance or accounting roles, preferably in the oil and gas sector.
	Professional certifications such as ICAN, ACCA, or CFA are an added advantage.


Desired Skills & Competencies:


	Strong financial acumen and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent leadership and problem-solving abilities.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Knowledge of financial regulations and best practices.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: wendy@feltonenergy.net using "Finance/Accounts Manager" as the subject of the email.l.

title: Job Openings at Runola Nigeria Limited

With a strong focus on innovation, efficiency, and excellence, we have established ourselves as a trusted name in the industry.

Our company operates across multiple locations, ensuring seamless production and service delivery while upholding the highest standards of professionalism. We value teamwork, integrity, and continuous growth, providing our employees with opportunities to excel in their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Truck Driver
     

            
    



Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a reliable and experienced Truck Driver to join our team in Asaba. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transporting goods safely and efficiently, ensuring timely deliveries, and maintaining the vehicle in good condition.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely operate company trucks to transport goods to designated locations.
	Ensure timely loading, delivery, and offloading of goods.
	Carry out routine checks and basic maintenance of the truck.
	Keep accurate records of deliveries, mileage, and fuel usage.
	Comply with all traffic regulations and company safety standards.
	Report any incidents, delays, or vehicle faults promptly.


Requirements


	Valid driver’s license (Class G or appropriate for heavy-duty vehicles).
	2–3 years of experience driving trucks.
	Good knowledge of road networks and traffic laws.
	Physically fit and able to handle long-distance driving.
	Responsible, disciplined, and safety-conscious.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@runola.ng using "Application for Truck Driver - Asaba" as the subject of the email.

Note: For further inquiries, please call 07016549893.

 

 

2.) Assistant Warehouse Officer

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Runofeed is seeking a male Assistant Warehouse Officer to support daily warehouse operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure efficient stock management, accurate record keeping, and smooth flow of goods in and out of the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in receiving, storing, and issuing raw materials and finished goods.
	Keep accurate records of all stock movements and transactions.
	Ensure proper arrangement, labeling, and safety of items in the warehouse.
	Assist in carrying out periodic stock counts and reconciliations.
	Monitor stock levels and report shortages or damages promptly.
	Support in loading and offloading goods.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse.


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 1–2 years of experience in warehouse/storekeeping roles.
	Male applicants only.
	Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills.
	Knowledge of inventory management systems is an added advantage.
	Ability to work in a team and handle physical tasks when required.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@runola.ng using “Application for Assistant Warehouse Officer – Runofeed” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Accounts Intern

Job Location: Along Ibusa-Asaba Expressway - Asaba, Delta 
Employment Type: Internship

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accounts Intern with a minimum of 2 years’ experience to support our finance team.
	The ideal candidate should be able to handle day-to-day accounting operations, maintain accurate financial records, and ensure smooth running of accounting processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Record daily financial transactions and update accounting systems.
	Prepare and issue invoices, receipts, and payment vouchers.
